connector.description: Communicate with Salesforce using Java DTOs.

camel.source.path.topicName.name: camel.source.path.topicName
camel.source.path.topicName.description: The name of the topic/channel to use

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIncrement.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIncrement
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIncrement.description: Backoff interval increment for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect.

camel.source.endpoint.contentType.name: camel.source.endpoint.contentType
camel.source.endpoint.contentType.description: Bulk API content type, one of XML, CSV, ZIP_XML, ZIP_CSV One of: [XML] [CSV] [JSON] [ZIP_XML] [ZIP_CSV] [ZIP_JSON]

camel.source.endpoint.defaultReplayId.name: camel.source.endpoint.defaultReplayId
camel.source.endpoint.defaultReplayId.description: Default replayId setting if no value is found in initialReplayIdMap

camel.source.endpoint.format.name: camel.source.endpoint.format
camel.source.endpoint.format.description: Payload format to use for Salesforce API calls, either JSON or XML, defaults to JSON One of: [JSON] [XML]

camel.source.endpoint.httpClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpClient
camel.source.endpoint.httpClient.description: Custom Jetty Http Client to use to connect to Salesforce.

camel.source.endpoint.includeDetails.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeDetails
camel.source.endpoint.includeDetails.description: Include details in Salesforce1 Analytics report, defaults to false.

camel.source.endpoint.initialReplayIdMap.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialReplayIdMap
camel.source.endpoint.initialReplayIdMap.description: Replay IDs to start from per channel name.

camel.source.endpoint.instanceId.name: camel.source.endpoint.instanceId
camel.source.endpoint.instanceId.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report execution instance ID

camel.source.endpoint.limit.name: camel.source.endpoint.limit
camel.source.endpoint.limit.description: Limit on number of returned records. Applicable to some of the API, check the Salesforce documentation.

camel.source.endpoint.maxBackoff.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxBackoff
camel.source.endpoint.maxBackoff.description: Maximum backoff interval for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect.

camel.source.endpoint.notFoundBehaviour.name: camel.source.endpoint.notFoundBehaviour
camel.source.endpoint.notFoundBehaviour.description: Sets the behaviour of 404 not found status received from Salesforce API. Should the body be set to NULL NotFoundBehaviour#NULL or should a exception be signaled on the exchange NotFoundBehaviour#EXCEPTION - the default. One of: [EXCEPTION] [NULL]

camel.source.endpoint.notifyForFields.name: camel.source.endpoint.notifyForFields
camel.source.endpoint.notifyForFields.description: Notify for fields, options are ALL, REFERENCED, SELECT, WHERE One of: [ALL] [REFERENCED] [SELECT] [WHERE]

camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.name: camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperationCreate
camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.description: Notify for create operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.name: camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperationDelete
camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.description: Notify for delete operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.name: camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperations
camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.description: Notify for operations, options are ALL, CREATE, EXTENDED, UPDATE (API version 29.0) One of: [ALL] [CREATE] [EXTENDED] [UPDATE]

camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.name: camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperationUndelete
camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.description: Notify for un-delete operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.name: camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperationUpdate
camel.source.endpoint.notifyForOperation.description: Notify for update operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.source.endpoint.objectMapper.name: camel.source.endpoint.objectMapper
camel.source.endpoint.objectMapper.description: Custom Jackson ObjectMapper to use when serializing/deserializing Salesforce objects.

camel.source.endpoint.rawPayload.name: camel.source.endpoint.rawPayload
camel.source.endpoint.rawPayload.description: Use raw payload String for request and response (either JSON or XML depending on format), instead of DTOs, false by default

camel.source.endpoint.reportMetadata.name: camel.source.endpoint.reportMetadata
camel.source.endpoint.reportMetadata.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report metadata for filtering

camel.source.endpoint.sObjectClass.name: camel.source.endpoint.sObjectClass
camel.source.endpoint.sObjectClass.description: Fully qualified SObject class name, usually generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin

camel.source.endpoint.sObjectId.name: camel.source.endpoint.sObjectId
camel.source.endpoint.sObjectId.description: SObject ID if required by API

camel.source.endpoint.sObjectName.name: camel.source.endpoint.sObjectName
camel.source.endpoint.sObjectName.description: SObject name if required or supported by API

camel.source.endpoint.updateTopic.name: camel.source.endpoint.updateTopic
camel.source.endpoint.updateTopic.description: Whether to update an existing Push Topic when using the Streaming API, defaults to false

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.replayId.name: camel.source.endpoint.replayId
camel.source.endpoint.replayId.description: The replayId value to use when subscribing

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.salesforce.backoffIncrem.name: camel.component.salesforce.backoffIncrement
camel.component.salesforce.backoffIncrem.description: Backoff interval increment for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect.

camel.component.salesforce.contentType.name: camel.component.salesforce.contentType
camel.component.salesforce.contentType.description: Bulk API content type, one of XML, CSV, ZIP_XML, ZIP_CSV One of: [XML] [CSV] [JSON] [ZIP_XML] [ZIP_CSV] [ZIP_JSON]

camel.component.salesforce.defaultReplay.name: camel.component.salesforce.defaultReplayId
camel.component.salesforce.defaultReplay.description: Default replayId setting if no value is found in initialReplayIdMap

camel.component.salesforce.format.name: camel.component.salesforce.format
camel.component.salesforce.format.description: Payload format to use for Salesforce API calls, either JSON or XML, defaults to JSON One of: [JSON] [XML]

camel.component.salesforce.httpClient.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpClient
camel.component.salesforce.httpClient.description: Custom Jetty Http Client to use to connect to Salesforce.

camel.component.salesforce.httpClientCon.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpClientConnectionTimeout
camel.component.salesforce.httpClientCon.description: Connection timeout used by the HttpClient when connecting to the Salesforce server.

camel.component.salesforce.httpClientIdl.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpClientIdleTimeout
camel.component.salesforce.httpClientIdl.description: Timeout used by the HttpClient when waiting for response from the Salesforce server.

camel.component.salesforce.httpMaxConten.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpMaxContentLength
camel.component.salesforce.httpMaxConten.description: Max content length of an HTTP response.

camel.component.salesforce.httpRequestBu.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpRequestBufferSize
camel.component.salesforce.httpRequestBu.description: HTTP request buffer size. May need to be increased for large SOQL queries.

camel.component.salesforce.includeDetail.name: camel.component.salesforce.includeDetails
camel.component.salesforce.includeDetail.description: Include details in Salesforce1 Analytics report, defaults to false.

camel.component.salesforce.initialReplay.name: camel.component.salesforce.initialReplayIdMap
camel.component.salesforce.initialReplay.description: Replay IDs to start from per channel name.

camel.component.salesforce.instanceId.name: camel.component.salesforce.instanceId
camel.component.salesforce.instanceId.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report execution instance ID

camel.component.salesforce.limit.name: camel.component.salesforce.limit
camel.component.salesforce.limit.description: Limit on number of returned records. Applicable to some of the API, check the Salesforce documentation.

camel.component.salesforce.maxBackoff.name: camel.component.salesforce.maxBackoff
camel.component.salesforce.maxBackoff.description: Maximum backoff interval for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect.

camel.component.salesforce.notFoundBehav.name: camel.component.salesforce.notFoundBehaviour
camel.component.salesforce.notFoundBehav.description: Sets the behaviour of 404 not found status received from Salesforce API. Should the body be set to NULL NotFoundBehaviour#NULL or should a exception be signaled on the exchange NotFoundBehaviour#EXCEPTION - the default. One of: [EXCEPTION] [NULL]

camel.component.salesforce.notifyForFiel.name: camel.component.salesforce.notifyForFields
camel.component.salesforce.notifyForFiel.description: Notify for fields, options are ALL, REFERENCED, SELECT, WHERE One of: [ALL] [REFERENCED] [SELECT] [WHERE]

camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.name: camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOperationCreate
camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.description: Notify for create operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.name: camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOperationDelete
camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.description: Notify for delete operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.name: camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOperations
camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.description: Notify for operations, options are ALL, CREATE, EXTENDED, UPDATE (API version 29.0) One of: [ALL] [CREATE] [EXTENDED] [UPDATE]

camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.name: camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOperationUndelete
camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.description: Notify for un-delete operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.name: camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOperationUpdate
camel.component.salesforce.notifyForOper.description: Notify for update operation, defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

camel.component.salesforce.objectMapper.name: camel.component.salesforce.objectMapper
camel.component.salesforce.objectMapper.description: Custom Jackson ObjectMapper to use when serializing/deserializing Salesforce objects.

camel.component.salesforce.packages.name: camel.component.salesforce.packages
camel.component.salesforce.packages.description: In what packages are the generated DTO classes. Typically the classes would be generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin. This must be set if using the XML format. Also, set it if using the generated DTOs to gain the benefit of using short SObject names in parameters/header values. Multiple packages can be separated by comma.

camel.component.salesforce.rawPayload.name: camel.component.salesforce.rawPayload
camel.component.salesforce.rawPayload.description: Use raw payload String for request and response (either JSON or XML depending on format), instead of DTOs, false by default

camel.component.salesforce.reportMetadat.name: camel.component.salesforce.reportMetadata
camel.component.salesforce.reportMetadat.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report metadata for filtering

camel.component.salesforce.sObjectClass.name: camel.component.salesforce.sObjectClass
camel.component.salesforce.sObjectClass.description: Fully qualified SObject class name, usually generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin

camel.component.salesforce.sObjectId.name: camel.component.salesforce.sObjectId
camel.component.salesforce.sObjectId.description: SObject ID if required by API

camel.component.salesforce.sObjectName.name: camel.component.salesforce.sObjectName
camel.component.salesforce.sObjectName.description: SObject name if required or supported by API

camel.component.salesforce.updateTopic.name: camel.component.salesforce.updateTopic
camel.component.salesforce.updateTopic.description: Whether to update an existing Push Topic when using the Streaming API, defaults to false

camel.component.salesforce.config.name: camel.component.salesforce.config
camel.component.salesforce.config.description: Global endpoint configuration - use to set values that are common to all endpoints

camel.component.salesforce.httpClientPro.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpClientProperties
camel.component.salesforce.httpClientPro.description: Used to set any properties that can be configured on the underlying HTTP client. Have a look at properties of SalesforceHttpClient and the Jetty HttpClient for all available options.

camel.component.salesforce.longPollingTr.name: camel.component.salesforce.longPollingTransportProperties
camel.component.salesforce.longPollingTr.description: Used to set any properties that can be configured on the LongPollingTransport used by the BayeuxClient (CometD) used by the streaming api

camel.component.salesforce.bridgeErrorHa.name: camel.component.salesforce.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.salesforce.bridgeErrorHa.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.salesforce.autowiredEnab.name: camel.component.salesforce.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.salesforce.autowiredEnab.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyExcl.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyExcludedAddresses
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyExcl.description: A list of addresses for which HTTP proxy server should not be used.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyHost.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyHost
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyHost.description: Hostname of the HTTP proxy server to use.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyIncl.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyIncludedAddresses
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyIncl.description: A list of addresses for which HTTP proxy server should be used.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyPort.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyPort
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyPort.description: Port number of the HTTP proxy server to use.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxySock.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxySocks4
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxySock.description: If set to true the configures the HTTP proxy to use as a SOCKS4 proxy.

camel.component.salesforce.authenticatio.name: camel.component.salesforce.authenticationType
camel.component.salesforce.authenticatio.description: Explicit authentication method to be used, one of USERNAME_PASSWORD, REFRESH_TOKEN or JWT. Salesforce component can auto-determine the authentication method to use from the properties set, set this property to eliminate any ambiguity. One of: [USERNAME_PASSWORD] [REFRESH_TOKEN] [JWT]

camel.component.salesforce.clientId.name: camel.component.salesforce.clientId
camel.component.salesforce.clientId.description: OAuth Consumer Key of the connected app configured in the Salesforce instance setup. Typically a connected app needs to be configured but one can be provided by installing a package.

camel.component.salesforce.clientSecret.name: camel.component.salesforce.clientSecret
camel.component.salesforce.clientSecret.description: OAuth Consumer Secret of the connected app configured in the Salesforce instance setup.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyAuth.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyAuthUri
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyAuth.description: Used in authentication against the HTTP proxy server, needs to match the URI of the proxy server in order for the httpProxyUsername and httpProxyPassword to be used for authentication.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyPass.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyPassword
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyPass.description: Password to use to authenticate against the HTTP proxy server.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyReal.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyRealm
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyReal.description: Realm of the proxy server, used in preemptive Basic/Digest authentication methods against the HTTP proxy server.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxySecu.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxySecure
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxySecu.description: If set to false disables the use of TLS when accessing the HTTP proxy.

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyUseD.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyUseDigestAuth
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyUseD.description: If set to true Digest authentication will be used when authenticating to the HTTP proxy, otherwise Basic authorization method will be used

camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyUser.name: camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyUsername
camel.component.salesforce.httpProxyUser.description: Username to use to authenticate against the HTTP proxy server.

camel.component.salesforce.instanceUrl.name: camel.component.salesforce.instanceUrl
camel.component.salesforce.instanceUrl.description: URL of the Salesforce instance used after authentication, by default received from Salesforce on successful authentication

camel.component.salesforce.keystore.name: camel.component.salesforce.keystore
camel.component.salesforce.keystore.description: KeyStore parameters to use in OAuth JWT flow. The KeyStore should contain only one entry with private key and certificate. Salesforce does not verify the certificate chain, so this can easily be a selfsigned certificate. Make sure that you upload the certificate to the corresponding connected app.

camel.component.salesforce.lazyLogin.name: camel.component.salesforce.lazyLogin
camel.component.salesforce.lazyLogin.description: If set to true prevents the component from authenticating to Salesforce with the start of the component. You would generally set this to the (default) false and authenticate early and be immediately aware of any authentication issues.

camel.component.salesforce.loginConfig.name: camel.component.salesforce.loginConfig
camel.component.salesforce.loginConfig.description: All authentication configuration in one nested bean, all properties set there can be set directly on the component as well

camel.component.salesforce.loginUrl.name: camel.component.salesforce.loginUrl
camel.component.salesforce.loginUrl.description: URL of the Salesforce instance used for authentication, by default set to https://login.salesforce.com

camel.component.salesforce.password.name: camel.component.salesforce.password
camel.component.salesforce.password.description: Password used in OAuth flow to gain access to access token. It's easy to get started with password OAuth flow, but in general one should avoid it as it is deemed less secure than other flows. Make sure that you append security token to the end of the password if using one.

camel.component.salesforce.refreshToken.name: camel.component.salesforce.refreshToken
camel.component.salesforce.refreshToken.description: Refresh token already obtained in the refresh token OAuth flow. One needs to setup a web application and configure a callback URL to receive the refresh token, or configure using the builtin callback at https://login.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/success or https://test.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/success and then retrive the refresh_token from the URL at the end of the flow. Note that in development organizations Salesforce allows hosting the callback web application at localhost.

camel.component.salesforce.sslContextPar.name: camel.component.salesforce.sslContextParameters
camel.component.salesforce.sslContextPar.description: SSL parameters to use, see SSLContextParameters class for all available options.

camel.component.salesforce.useGlobalSslC.name: camel.component.salesforce.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.salesforce.useGlobalSslC.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters

camel.component.salesforce.userName.name: camel.component.salesforce.userName
camel.component.salesforce.userName.description: Username used in OAuth flow to gain access to access token. It's easy to get started with password OAuth flow, but in general one should avoid it as it is deemed less secure than other flows.
